entry.title: New York Times Listening Table
entry.quote: The New York Times invents a conference table that takes notes for you it’s called the listening table, and it not only transcribes meetings, but knows when they’re important.

entry.title: Google Bets on Health: 'The Most You Can Lose Is All Your Money'
entry.quote: GV is going further, making bets in sectors overseen by the Food and Drug Administration like drugs and medical devices. Maris says he’s willing to deal with long schedules and regulatory hiccups.

entry.title: Alexa, Unlock the Internet
entry.quote: Having a dedicated device for these early days of voice interaction seems key. Because people aren’t yet used to talking to machines, there needs to be a bridge to get there. That bridge, I think, will be Echo.

entry.title: Gearing Up for the Cloud, AT&T Tells Its Workers: Adapt, or Else
entry.quote: In 2012, Mr. Stephenson realized, much to his dismay, that his staff was woefully unschooled for the new technology. Vision 2020, as the company calls it, is a program that combines online and classroom-based course work in subjects like digital networking and data science, as well as a look at old skills that can be transferred to new careers.

entry.title: Learning The Alphabet
entry.quote: How schools around the country are turning dead Microsoft PCs into speedy Chromebooks
